  • Vous possédez une expérience sur des frameworks de Machine Learning bien connus : Scikit-

learn, TensorFlow/Keras, TFx, PyTorch(un plus) …

  • Vous avez une expérience en industrialisation de systèmes de machine learning
  • Vous disposez d’une expérience avec Docker, et un orchestrateur (kubeflow, airflow …),

kubernetes, Git, Gitlab CI/CD (un plus)

  • Vous utilisez Google Cloud Platform (Storage, BigQuery,Dataproc, Dataflow, AI Platform, …)
  • Vous avez des connaissances sur les outils DevOps pour AI et ML (MLOps)
  • Vous êtes capable d’échanger en anglais technique écrit et oral


Informations complémentaires

  • Votre poste sera basé à Boulogne-Billancourt (France) en CDI (temps plein)
  • Vous bénéficiez de 2 à 3 jours de télétravail par semaine


Vous êtes prêt(e)s à relever avec nous tous ces défis, n’hésitez pas à postuler !!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🌟 Allow us to introduce ourselves:

Ancient Gaming, an innovative software creator for the future of iGaming, bucks the trend that has lacked innovation for two decades. We're not trend followers; we're trendsetters. As iGaming pioneers, we challenge the status quo, crafting not just appealing software but a whole new experience for the innovative, high-spending generation seeking to reinvent gaming interactions.

Founded in 2018 in Malta, we've become a global presence with 100+ dedicated team members spanning across 30+ countries. And yes, we're proudly remote-first!




🚀 Your mission as a Data Scientist!

As a Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in leveraging data to drive business insights, optimize player experiences, and shape the future of iGaming. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including product development, marketing, and customer support, to analyze large datasets and provide actionable recommendations. Your work will directly impact our strategic decisions and contribute to our continued growth and success.




You will be working on:

CSGORoll: the world’s #1 skin gaming site. A community social gaming platform targeted towards CS2 players, featuring unique in-house custom-built games such as Roulette, Crash, Unboxing, and PVP.




What you’ll be doing:

Analyzing and interpreting complex datasets to extract actionable insights and trends.
Developing and implementing data models, algorithms, and statistical techniques to solve business problems and improve player engagement.
Collaborating with product and marketing teams to identify data-driven opportunities and strategies.
Designing and conducting A/B tests to evaluate the impact of new features and changes.
Creating data visualizations and dashboards to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and advancements in data science and machine learning.




You will thrive in this role if you have:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 4 years of experience in a data science role within the Gaming/iGaming industry.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Strong experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to communicate complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.




What’s in it for you?

Flexibility Policy – It's about giving you the freedom to structure your workday in a way that best suits your lifestyle and responsibilities outside of work
Work-from-anywhere Policy – you have the chance to work from anywhere in the world, we are a remote-first company and we are proud of it!
Every year for our team-building we choose a location and go there to celebrate our achievements together
A dedicated budget to purchase all the equipment you need to set up your home office
L&D budget for you to develop your skills!
Spill Mental Health Service – full access to counseling for any employees who need it
Innovative, fun, flat structured rapidly growing company with endless opportunities to grow




This post not only outlines our ideal candidate but also serves as an inspiration for what this role can evolve into. Even if you consider yourself an 80% fit but have a genuine passion for this position, we encourage you to apply. We're eager to hear from individuals who share our enthusiasm. Ancient Gaming is an equal-opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Airties

At Airties we are on a mission to empower broadband operators to deliver a better-connected home experience for their subscribers. We have an exciting story to tell, and we want you to help us tell it!

Airties offers broadband operators advanced Wi-Fi solutions and services to allow them bring an improved user experience for their subscribers. The Airties portfolio includes Smart Wi-Fi software, a cloud-based experience management platform with its companion app and data engine. Our company also offers expert, bespoke engineering and testing services.

Globally, Airties is the most widely deployed provider of Smart Wi-Fi solutions to network service providers and our technologies are driving a better-connected user experience in more than 35 million homes.




Your role and impact

Are you an analytical mind who’s first reflex for any problem is to get the answers from the data?

Do you regularly handle machine learning algorithms, turning them solutions for real-world pains?

Is the full lifecycle of data solutions familiar to you? From the first proof of concept to deploying v2.0 into production and monitoring its value?

Do you speak both business and stats, translating seemlessly from one to the other and back?




If yes, then you may be that person we are looking for! Airties seeks a Belgium-based Data Scientist to strengthen its data solutions team. We are especially looking for a candidate who knows their way around data pipeline and lifecycle management.







What you will do:

Create, evolute and manage of data-driven solutions, including ML pipelines
Support product managers and R&D to define the right KPIs in their solutions
Assist customers and other teams in finding answers to their data questions
Leverage Airties Data Lake to prove the value of our solutions




What you should ideally bring:

MS, MEng or PhD in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Physics
5+ years of experience in data science and/or data engineering. This is a senior role
Proven experience with the full ML lifecycle, including updates to production
Working experience with MLflow
Experienced Spark and Python user
Excellent spoken and written English. As an international company, Airties is an English-language environment
Attention for detail in and consistency across deliverables
Self-directed: knows how to plan and execute themselves to achieve a larger goal







Airties has a zero tolerance to discrimination policy. In this regard, during the course of the evaluation of your job application and during all your employment relation, if any, all discriminatory factors such as race, sex, sexual orientation, social gender definitions/roles, colour, national or social background, ethnicity, religion, age, disablement, political opinion or any status that is protected under law shall be totally disregarded.




*By applying to this job opening, you agree, acknowledge and consent to the transfer of your personal data by Airties either to or from Turkey, as the case may be; in particular to its affiliated companies.




*By applying to this job opening, you agree, acknowledge and consent to the transfer of your personal data by Airties to its headquarters established in France.

HTML:
About Airties

At Airties we are on a mission to empower broadband operators to deliver a better-connected home experience for their subscribers. We have an exciting story to tell, and we want you to help us tell it!

Airties offers broadband operators advanced Wi-Fi solutions and services to allow them bring an improved user experience for their subscribers. The Airties portfolio includes Smart Wi-Fi software, a cloud-based experience management platform with its companion app and data engine. Our company also offers expert, bespoke engineering and testing services.

Globally, Airties is the most widely deployed provider of Smart Wi-Fi solutions to network service providers and our technologies are driving a better-connected user experience in more than 35 million homes.


Your role and impact

Are you an analytical mind who’s first reflex for any problem is to get the answers from the data?

Do you regularly handle machine learning algorithms, turning them solutions for real-world pains?

Is the full lifecycle of data solutions familiar to you? From the first proof of concept to deploying v2.0 into production and monitoring its value?

Do you speak both business and stats, translating seemlessly from one to the other and back?


If yes, then you may be that person we are looking for! Airties seeks a Belgium-based Data Scientist to strengthen its data solutions team. We are especially looking for a candidate who knows their way around data pipeline and lifecycle management.



What you will do:

  • Create, evolute and manage of data-driven solutions, including ML pipelines
  • Support product managers and R&D to define the right KPIs in their solutions
  • Assist customers and other teams in finding answers to their data questions
  • Leverage Airties Data Lake to prove the value of our solutions


What you should ideally bring:

  • MS, MEng or PhD in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Physics
  • 5+ years of experience in data science and/or data engineering. This is a senior role
  • Proven experience with the full ML lifecycle, including updates to production
  • Working experience with MLflow
  • Experienced Spark and Python user
  • Excellent spoken and written English. As an international company, Airties is an English-language environment
  • Attention for detail in and consistency across deliverables
  • Self-directed: knows how to plan and execute themselves to achieve a larger goal



Airties has a zero tolerance to discrimination policy. In this regard, during the course of the evaluation of your job application and during all your employment relation, if any, all discriminatory factors such as race, sex, sexual orientation, social gender definitions/roles, colour, national or social background, ethnicity, religion, age, disablement, political opinion or any status that is protected under law shall be totally disregarded.


*By applying to this job opening, you agree, acknowledge and consent to the transfer of your personal data by Airties either to or from Turkey, as the case may be; in particular to its affiliated companies.


*By applying to this job opening, you agree, acknowledge and consent to the transfer of your personal data by Airties to its headquarters established in France.

Title: Data Scientist (GenAI)
Description:
About Fusemachines

Fusemachines is a 10+ year old AI company, dedicated to delivering state-of-the-art AI products and solutions to a diverse range of industries. Founded by Sameer Maskey, Ph.D., an Adjunct Associate Professor at Columbia University, our company is on a steadfast mission to democratize AI and harness the power of global AI talent from underserved communities. With a robust presence in four countries and a dedicated team of over 400 full-time employees, we are committed to fostering AI transformation journeys for businesses worldwide. At Fusemachines, we not only bridge the gap between AI advancement and its global impact but also strive to deliver the most advanced technology solutions to the world.

About The Role

This is a remote, contract based role for 3 - 6 months with possibility of extension. As a Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and implementing Machine Learning models and Generative AI solutions. You will work closely with ML Engineers, Data Engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure our AI applications are robust, scalable, and impactful.

Roles And Responsibilities

Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:


Own and develop Machine Learning solutions to solve unstructured, complex business problems
Maintain and optimize existing Machine Learning solutions and improve them with more efficient methods
Monitor models’ performance in production to ensure the highest quality level, report on development status, identify risk areas and support the Data Science team
Build state-of-the-art & cost-efficient solutions leveraging GenAI models for multiple use cases (summarisation, classification, chatbots)
Perform statistical analysis on existing and new datasets to help SME stakeholders identify areas for improvement
Communicate technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders successfully
Research new methods and techniques in AI/ML to improve processes and methodologies


Required Skills

The individual applying for this role must have 2-4 years of experience as a Data Scientist building production-ready Machine Learning solutions.


Experience with common Machine Learning frameworks and methods and developing business-oriented data solutions (e.g., data mining, process optimization, predictive modeling)
Experience building GenAI solutions with LLMs and familiarity with both open-source and Proprietary LLMs
Proficiency in using Databricks for developing and managing machine learning workflows
A background in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Maths, Statistics, Engineering), or a PhD with a focus on quantitative methodologies. Don’t be afraid to apply for this role if you come from a different background, as long as you have relevant experience
Strong coding skills: Python (it’s a must), SQL, PySpark, and R are used across multiple projects
Hands-on experience with Machine Learning libraries such as Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, or H2O
Hands-on experience with LLMs to build RAG solutions using Hugging Face, LangChain, and/or OpenAI models
Problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and a creative mindset
Excellent written and verbal communication
Excellent organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment and remain composed under pressure
A good level of English is expected (C1/C2)


Fusemachines is an Equal Opportunities Employer, committed to diversity and inclusion. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Analyst/Scientist
Description:
OUR HIRING PROCESS:


We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals—every person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.


We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst/Scientist to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling, with a keen ability to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and implement AI/ML models and algorithms, particularly focusing on LLM.
Managing the entire data lifecycle, from data collection and cleaning to model training, deployment, and inference.
Be proficient in utilizing various data engineering tools and frameworks to ensure seamless data flow and possess the ability to build, train, and deploy machine learning models in production environments.
Analyze complex datasets using strong analytical skills to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Conduct a thorough evaluation of AI and machine learning tools and strategically adopt those that have the potential to improve key business processes significantly.
Collaborate on defining and implementing KPIs to measure business success based on insights derived from machine learning models and data analysis.
Ensure data quality by cleaning and validating results data for accuracy.
Analyze current data structures, tagging, and quality standards. Recommend improvements and identify and address data anomalies.


Qualifications:


Master's degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, financial engineering, or a similar field.
Minimum of 3 years of proven experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
E2E data flow, model training/deployment and inference expertise
Expertise in developing and deploying AI/ML models using Python libraries, including pre-processing, analysis, model selection, and performance evaluation.
Demonstrated experience with Generative AI, feature repository development for AI/ML models, LLM embeddings and fine-tuningon custom datasets for specific use cases.
Strong analytical skills for data manipulation, cleaning, and insightful reporting with meticulous attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases.
Experience in business analysis and design, data modeling (including planning, requirement gathering, and documentation).
Technical expertise in data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and provide innovative solutions.
Exceptional communication skills to effectively present findings and recommendations.


We offer:


Competitive compensation, which will take into account the experience and skills of the candidate. Form of payment - monthly, based on Invoice - Bank transfer/Payoneer
Remote, Work schedule: 5/2 (8-hour working day) from 13:00 to 22:00 EEST (incl. 60-min breaks, Flexible schedule is possible)
Interesting and long-term project
We support work-life balance and offer paid annual leave and paid sick days
Shorter Fridays (6 working hours) in Summertime.
Opportunities for professional development and career growth


Our recruitment process:


Interview with HR + one-way video interview
Test tasks
Technical interview with Team
Final interview with the Technical director

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
CT19 are working with one of our key MedTech clients in the South of France who are actively hiring for a Data Scientist to join their expanding R&D and Product Development team. This company are at the forefront of technology, combining AI, Robotics and image processing to revolutionise the surgery for cardiovascular related disease.




In just 4 years since being founded, they have grown to a company of circa 30 employee's, all primarily in engineering /R&D disciplines. They have also developed their technology to the point where surgery has been performed successfully on an animal model, considering medical devices can take time to get to market, this is very impressive!




We are looking for someone who has proven experience working in the Medical device industry, ideally within medical image processing and has taken a product through to FDA clearance.




Please see below for more information about what you can expect from the day to day:

Be a key contributor to new technology development in the area of computer vision and machine learning
Develop learning based solutions for a variety of tasks in medical data/imaging analysis
Further enhance medical software applications and patents
Write and maintain accurate documentation of concepts, algorithms and regulations




Skillset/experience we are looking for:

Strong academic background in computer science/software engineering
experience with FDA documentation (worked to IEC 62304)
Strong proficiency in Python, C and C++
Proven background in mathematics, statistics, data structure and algorithms
Proficiency in one of the mainstream deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow/PyTorch
Hands on experience with medical image processing and 3D data visualization




Please reach out to mason@ct-19.co.uk for more information.

Title: Data Scientist (w/m)
Description:
We are Deutsche Telekom IT Spain, located in a digital, scientific, and cultural hub of Spain - Valencia.




We work as part of T-Systems Iberia though with a separate structure and projects. Our team is growing, and we are looking forward to meeting more talented employees.

With our highly skilled engineers and experts, we are committed to continue developing the culture of creativity and agility, foster innovations, and be an international tech center!




Our Data team is looking for Data Scientist!

This Team is working around several directions:

Modeling customer individual network perception by Implementing initial data model representing e.g., mobile inventory, performance and usage data. Generate new insights by understanding detractor and promotor data pattern. Push positive network perception.

Drive quality improvements through cross-functional use case development. Provide technology data products based on OSS- and live network components, e.g., performance, event and line configuration data. Support centrally Fault 2 repair process.

Push data driven e2e use cases for fiber business. Powered by a consolidated data foundation as single point of truth. In order to enable a collaborative, cross-functional fiber steering




What we expect:

As a data scientist you are part mathematician, part computer scientist, and you rule the world of big data.

You will both do classical data analytics as well as create machine learning models for explaining and predicting home network events. You will cooperate closely with our business colleagues to derive actions based on your analytics to increase our home network CX.




Required Skills and experience:

• CDSW (Cloudera Data Science Workbench)

• Jira

• Hue

• Knime

• ODL

• ODE

• SQL

• Python

• Pandas

• PythonSpark

• English level B2

• Willingness to work in an agile environment.




🤲What do we offer you?




International, positive, dynamic, and motivated work environment.
Hybrid work model (telework/face-to-face).
Flexible schedule.
Continuous training.
Flexible Compensation Plan.
Life and accident insurance.




And many more advantages of being part of T-Systems!




If you are looking for a new challenge, do not hesitate to send us your CV! Please send CV in English.




Join our team!

Title: Principal Data Scientist - AI start-up 4 Big Pharma - €87k + 10% bonus
Description:
Principal Data Scientist - AI start-up 4 Big Pharma - €87k + 10% bonus

Industry: AI software for Pharma, start-up - heavily backed by a global investor

Workplace: Hybrid - 2 days per week

Offices: Barcelona or Madrid




Our client, the AI tech firm, are changing the world of Pharma, their AI is literally flying off the shelf and the leading Pharma's in the market are knocking on their door as nobody else can do what they can. Come and join this rocket-ship, be part of something that is genuinely improving the world around us, using Artificial Intelligence.




We need a Principal Data Scientist who has experience leading a team, is this you?




Tech stack / experience needed:

Python
Machine Learning
Data tooling, Airflow, DBT
Hands-on SQL
AWS
Docker; Kubernetes
Data engineering knowledge
Business acumen, experience with stakeholders
Experience with embeddings, genAI and some LLM fine tuning
Calibration of unbalanced problems, RF vs XGB, data leakage with oversampling
Coding experience
PhD or Masters in Engineering or Mathematics




Do you know how the data you're working with effects the business? This question is KEY.

Do you have a passion/interest for Tech / AI and see how it can help improve Healthcare?

Are you a people-person and someone who can work in an start-up, nimble environment?




You'll be working closely with the Data Engineers, joining a fast-paced, Agile, start-up environment, where there won't be a whole load of processes, which some will find difficult and others will thrive in....we hope you're the latter!




The position can be based in either Barcelona or Madrid.




Message me on here and we can discuss the company and position in more detail - matt@hawksworthuk.com




I look forward to hearing from you.




#artificialintelligence #datascience #pharma #munich #madrid #barcelona #gamechanging

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Senior Data Scientist







Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Senior Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics Team on the Customer Interactions and Monetization Tribe in Spain.




The responsibility of this team is to develop all type of models and analytical products in the field of Machine Learning and Big Data context for the whole Retail Organization. Our way of working mirrors our eagerness to innovate and the agile methodologies are on our daily basis.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Senior Data Scientist you will:




Positively be expected to take charge of end to end design and delivery of machine learning products across different departments in the bank. Which means all type of AI/ML products such as credit risk decision making models, churn, recommendation systems, NLP, income/expenses estimations, data categorization, clustering and segmentation, pricing, OCR, etc…).

Co-create and assess business with the best predictive solution and work in a cross-functional and international team formed by business colleagues, data analyst, data scientists and engineers.

Ensure the designed product meets business requirements, brings the most to the clients and that it complies with our high coding and development standards.




What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits… don’t hesitate to apply!




We are seeking a passionate and highly skilled Data Scientist used to work near to business, understand the challenges and who proposes solutions proactively, defining the appropriate analytical solution for each challenge.




Our dreamed candidate will be:

A value oriented person
With a degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or related field.
Demonstrable experience in data analysis, visualization and building predictive models (specially supervised ones).
Strong knowledge of languages such as SQL, Python and distributed computing tools (Spark, Hadoop, Hive, etc.) as well as machine learning libraries.
Used to work with Git for peer review and code repositoring.
Ability to communicate technical findings clearly and comprehensibly even for non-technical audiences.
Teamwork skills and ability to tackle complex challenges.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but… What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.




Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn’t take up your time or your cravings.




Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!




Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.




Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids…




Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.




Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!




More vitality and more belonging

360º care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Runners club with your own trainer.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+) & Leonas.

HTML:
At ING we are looking for a Senior Data Scientist



Your role and work environment:


We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Senior Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics Team on the Customer Interactions and Monetization Tribe in Spain.


The responsibility of this team is to develop all type of models and analytical products in the field of Machine Learning and Big Data context for the whole Retail Organization. Our way of working mirrors our eagerness to innovate and the agile methodologies are on our daily basis.


Your key responsibilities:


As a Senior Data Scientist you will:


Positively be expected to take charge of end to end design and delivery of machine learning products across different departments in the bank. Which means all type of AI/ML products such as credit risk decision making models, churn, recommendation systems, NLP, income/expenses estimations, data categorization, clustering and segmentation, pricing, OCR, etc…).

Co-create and assess business with the best predictive solution and work in a cross-functional and international team formed by business colleagues, data analyst, data scientists and engineers.

Ensure the designed product meets business requirements, brings the most to the clients and that it complies with our high coding and development standards.


What are we looking for?


Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits… don’t hesitate to apply!


We are seeking a passionate and highly skilled Data Scientist used to work near to business, understand the challenges and who proposes solutions proactively, defining the appropriate analytical solution for each challenge.


Our dreamed candidate will be:

  • A value oriented person
  • With a degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or related field.
  • Demonstrable experience in data analysis, visualization and building predictive models (specially supervised ones).
  • Strong knowledge of languages such as SQL, Python and distributed computing tools (Spark, Hadoop, Hive, etc.) as well as machine learning libraries.
  • Used to work with Git for peer review and code repositoring.
  • Ability to communicate technical findings clearly and comprehensibly even for non-technical audiences.
  • Teamwork skills and ability to tackle complex challenges.


What do we offer?


The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but… What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.


Check out what is waiting for you!


Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.


Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn’t take up your time or your cravings.


Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!


Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).


Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.


Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids…


Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.


Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!


More vitality and more belonging

360º care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Title: Data Analyst/Scientist
Description:
OUR HIRING PROCESS:


We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals—every person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.


We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst/Scientist to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling, with a keen ability to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and implement AI/ML models and algorithms, particularly focusing on LLM.
Managing the entire data lifecycle, from data collection and cleaning to model training, deployment, and inference.
Be proficient in utilizing various data engineering tools and frameworks to ensure seamless data flow and possess the ability to build, train, and deploy machine learning models in production environments.
Analyze complex datasets using strong analytical skills to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Conduct a thorough evaluation of AI and machine learning tools and strategically adopt those that have the potential to improve key business processes significantly.
Collaborate on defining and implementing KPIs to measure business success based on insights derived from machine learning models and data analysis.
Ensure data quality by cleaning and validating results data for accuracy.
Analyze current data structures, tagging, and quality standards. Recommend improvements and identify and address data anomalies.


Qualifications:


Master's degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, financial engineering, or a similar field.
Minimum of 3 years of proven experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
E2E data flow, model training/deployment and inference expertise
Expertise in developing and deploying AI/ML models using Python libraries, including pre-processing, analysis, model selection, and performance evaluation.
Demonstrated experience with Generative AI, feature repository development for AI/ML models, LLM embeddings and fine-tuningon custom datasets for specific use cases.
Strong analytical skills for data manipulation, cleaning, and insightful reporting with meticulous attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases.
Experience in business analysis and design, data modeling (including planning, requirement gathering, and documentation).
Technical expertise in data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and provide innovative solutions.
Exceptional communication skills to effectively present findings and recommendations.


We offer:


Competitive compensation, which will take into account the experience and skills of the candidate. Form of payment - monthly, based on Invoice - Bank transfer/Payoneer
Remote, Work schedule: 5/2 (8-hour working day) from 13:00 to 22:00 EEST (incl. 60-min breaks, Flexible schedule is possible)
Interesting and long-term project
We support work-life balance and offer paid annual leave and paid sick days
Shorter Fridays (6 working hours) in Summertime.
Opportunities for professional development and career growth


Our recruitment process:


Interview with HR + one-way video interview
Test tasks
Technical interview with Team
Final interview with the Technical director

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Coders Connect is partnering with a cutting-edge biotechnology company specializing in the development of predictive preclinical research solutions. Their innovative solutions support advancements in biomedical and pharmaceutical research, enhancing the predictability and success of clinical studies.




One of the 3 drivers for the company's strategic plan is how levering data will improve their models and therefore bring drugs more quickly and safely to market.

Due to its strong scientific focus and its global pharmaceutical partners, the company generates and has access to a large volume and variety of data. For example:




Omics data: expression profile of thousands of proteins/RNAs
Bioprocess data: historical data with tens of parameters and hundreds of experiments
Business data: historical data with tens of thousands of prospects history
Bibliographic data: tens of thousands of documents of interest




Role Overview:

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join their dynamic team and play a key role in developing data-driven solutions that enhance preclinical research. This is a fantastic opportunity to work with state-of-the-art technologies, collaborate with experts, and contribute to groundbreaking research.




What You'll Do:

Data Analysis: Perform complex data analyses and develop predictive models to support preclinical research projects.
Collaborative Development: Work closely with software engineers and other team members to integrate data science solutions into the broader research framework.
Model Building: Develop and refine machine learning models to extract actionable insights from large datasets.
Data Visualisation: Create clear and insightful data visualisations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Research Support: Assist in the design and analysis of experiments, contributing to the development of new research methodologies.
Continuous Learning: Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in data science and related technologies, applying new knowledge to enhance project outcomes




Requirements:




Technical Proficiency:

Proficiency in data science programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL) and experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).




Skills:

Analytical Skills: Strong analytical abilities to interpret complex datasets and derive meaningful insights.
Communication: Effective communication skills to present technical information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: Excellent problem-solving skills, with a proactive approach to overcoming challenges.




Experience & Mindset:

Experience in data science, with a background in applying machine learning and statistical techniques to real-world problems. (3-5 years)
Industry Knowledge: Familiarity with biomedical or pharmaceutical research is a plus, but not required.
Innovative: Enthusiasm for exploring new technologies and methodologies in data science.
Flexible: Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Collaborative: Strong team player with a focus on collaboration and shared success.
Detail-Oriented: Attention to detail, ensuring precision and accuracy in all data-related tasks.




Benefits

Innovative Projects: Contribute to pioneering research that advances preclinical study outcomes.
Cutting-Edge Technology: Work with the latest data science tools and technologies.
Professional Growth: Benefit from continuous learning opportunities and the chance to develop your skills in a dynamic environment.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a supportive and innovative team that values collaboration and shared success.
Impactful Work: Play a crucial role in projects that have real-world applications in the biomedical and pharmaceutical fields.




Join us and be part of a team that is driving innovation and making a real difference in the field of preclinical research. Apply today!

Show more

Title: Junior Data Scientist (Remote)
Description:
Embark on a career in data science with Kreativstorm, a leading management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and turn data into actionable insights!

Are you passionate about data and eager to uncover insights that drive business decisions? Kreativstorm is looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our team. You will analyze and interpret complex datasets, develop predictive models, and collaborate with the data team to extract insights. This role offers an excellent opportunity to develop your analytical skills and make a significant impact.

Job Overview and Details:


Location: Fully Remote
Position: Full-Time


Requirements

Ideal Candidates:


Pursuing or having a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Junior data scientists with a strong interest in data analysis and machine learning.
Proficiency in data science tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Your Role:


Analyze and interpret complex datasets.
Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms.
Collaborate with the data team to extract insights and inform decisions.
Document and present data science findings.
Support in implementing data-driven solutions.


Benefits

Why Join Us? Kreativstorm offers a dynamic and innovative environment. You will work with a team of data experts, gaining hands-on experience in data science and machine learning. We value creativity, collaboration, and data-driven decision-making. Join us to enhance your data science skills and contribute to the success of our clients.

Apply now and pave the way for your future in data science!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Welcome to Homa, the gaming technology lab that is taking the industry by storm! Our team of over 200 people, hailing from more than 35 different countries, is dedicated to empowering mobile game creators worldwide to bring their creative ideas to the top charts.

Our Homa Lab platform offers a comprehensive suite of cutting-edge tools that allow developers to stay on top of the latest trends, test new features in real-time, and easily distribute and monetize their games. Our success speaks for itself - our apps have been downloaded over 1 billion times!

Since our inception, we have raised $165 million in total from prominent investors, including Headline, Northzone, Eurazeo, Singular, Quadrille Capital, Fabric Ventures, and Bpifrance. We have also received support from renowned business angels, such as the founders of King, Sorare and Spotify founders.

But what really makes Homa special is our team. We are a diverse group of artists, business developers, engineers, entrepreneurs, and former strategy consultants who all share the same passion for taking over the gaming industry. When you become part of Homa, you'll be joining a dedicated team that creates innovative and high-performing games that resonate with players worldwide.

If you're ready to take your career to the next level and make a real impact in the company, then Homa is the perfect place for you. Join us and let's create the future of gaming together!

Meet the team 👩‍👩‍👧‍👧

You will join the Data department organized into:


A Data Platform team with 5 Data Engineers responsible for ingesting large amounts of data from multiple different sources, creating and maintaining a core data model which aims at making data standardized, reliable and easily available
A Data Science and ML Platform team with 4 Data Scientists / ML Engineer working on ML-driven data products: Autobidder for User Acquisition, N-Testing for experimentation
An Advanced Analytics & Data Science team with 6 Data Analysts and Scientists exploiting our data for:
Game Analytics
User Acquisition and Marketing Analytics
Market Inteligence Analytics
Ops Analytics



Role and Missions — What you will do 🚀

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join the team in order to scale and industrialize Machine Learning & AI at Homa. Under the responsibility of our Associate Director, your responsibilities will be the following:


Take part in ML Projects: Spearhead development and implementation of ML models for Marketing Tech (User Acquisition, Monetization) and Game Tech (Bayesian A/B Testing, Segmentation)
ML Industrialization & Democratization: Enhance ML engineering processes, adopt ML Ops tools, and contribute to model interpretability and collaborative efforts
Implement Scalable ML Solutions: Build Serving APIs for handling millions of requests daily with low latency
Collaborative Innovation: Work closely with diverse teams, leveraging GenAI tools for productivity and product improvements
Stay Updated: Integrate latest ML technologies and advancements into our tech stack
Current Tech Stack: AWS, Redshift, Databricks, Python, DBT, Spark, Airflow, Kafka, Kubernetes, LightGBM, MLFlow, Metabase



Requirements

If you're creative, ambitious, and up for taking over the industry, we want you on our team! We are also looking for:


First ML Experience: :2 years in implementing and deploying ML models to production
Key Technology Proficiency: Experience in Neural Networks (TensorFlow / PyTorch), Gradient Boosting libraries (LightGBM / XGBoost), and at least one top Cloud provider (GCP, Azure, AWS)
MLOps Skills: Knowledge of ML Ops tools like MLFlow
API Development Expertise: Ability in building high-performance Serving APIs
Collaborative Skills: Excellent communication and teamwork abilities
Innovative Mindset: Passion for staying ahead in ML trends and technologies
Language Skills: Fluency English is mandatory (interviews will be led in English)



Our Culture—Who we are🪐

At Homa, we are building a community of brilliant talents. We believe that true innovation comes from diversity and collaboration, and that's why we prioritize brainpower and determination over formal education. So if you have the talent, energy and motivation, there is no obstacle to your success here.

As the creative experts behind the platform, we provide developers with the data they need to bring their ideas to life. Our team lives by three central values that guide everything we do:

✨Ambition: we're not afraid to tackle difficult challenges and set our goals extremely high. We're on a mission to revolutionize an industry dominated by well-established companies, and we won't stop until we succeed.

✨Humility: we leave our pride & ego aside. We are always ready to lend a helping hand, celebrate each other's successes, and learn from our failures. As Mr. Lamar said, "Sit down. Be humble."

✨Curiosity: we keep our minds open and never stop learning. We believe that questioning everything is the best way to stay ahead of the curve, and we encourage all our team members to stay curious and never stop exploring new ideas.

At Homa, you'll be challenged, supported, and inspired every day, and we can't wait to see what you bring to the table.

Benefits

While success is its own reward, here are some of the benefits that come with working at Homa:


We offer essential benefits in France and specific locations, including health insurance, meal vouchers, public transport subsidies, childcare benefits, and life insurance
If you're interested in working from our newly renovated Paris HQ with a rooftop garden and WeWork amenities, we have a desk waiting for you
You will be working in English with our international team of top-tier talents from 35+ countries
You will have bi-annual reviews with your manager to reflect on your performance, celebrate wins, and receive constructive feedback
You will be able to attend diverse team events and Workations (the famous company-wide Homa trip)
Show more
HTML:
Welcome to Homa, the gaming technology lab that is taking the industry by storm! Our team of over 200 people, hailing from more than 35 different countries, is dedicated to empowering mobile game creators worldwide to bring their creative ideas to the top charts.

Our Homa Lab platform offers a comprehensive suite of cutting-edge tools that allow developers to stay on top of the latest trends, test new features in real-time, and easily distribute and monetize their games. Our success speaks for itself - our apps have been downloaded over 1 billion times!

Since our inception, we have raised $165 million in total from prominent investors, including Headline, Northzone, Eurazeo, Singular, Quadrille Capital, Fabric Ventures, and Bpifrance. We have also received support from renowned business angels, such as the founders of King, Sorare and Spotify founders.

But what really makes Homa special is our team. We are a diverse group of artists, business developers, engineers, entrepreneurs, and former strategy consultants who all share the same passion for taking over the gaming industry. When you become part of Homa, you'll be joining a dedicated team that creates innovative and high-performing games that resonate with players worldwide.

If you're ready to take your career to the next level and make a real impact in the company, then Homa is the perfect place for you. Join us and let's create the future of gaming together!

  • Ops Analytics

  • ML Industrialization & Democratization: Enhance ML engineering processes, adopt ML Ops tools, and contribute to model interpretability and collaborative efforts
  • Implement Scalable ML Solutions: Build Serving APIs for handling millions of requests daily with low latency
  • Collaborative Innovation: Work closely with diverse teams, leveraging GenAI tools for productivity and product improvements
  • Stay Updated: Integrate latest ML technologies and advancements into our tech stack
  • Current Tech Stack: AWS, Redshift, Databricks, Python, DBT, Spark, Airflow, Kafka, Kubernetes, LightGBM, MLFlow, Metabase


Requirements

  • MLOps Skills: Knowledge of ML Ops tools like MLFlow
  • API Development Expertise: Ability in building high-performance Serving APIs
  • Collaborative Skills: Excellent communication and teamwork abilities
  • Innovative Mindset: Passion for staying ahead in ML trends and technologies
  • Language Skills: Fluency English is mandatory (interviews will be led in English)


Our Culture—Who we are🪐

At Homa, we are building a community of brilliant talents. We believe that true innovation comes from diversity and collaboration, and that's why we prioritize brainpower and determination over formal education. So if you have the talent, energy and motivation, there is no obstacle to your success here.

✨Humility: we leave our pride & ego aside. We are always ready to lend a helping hand, celebrate each other's successes, and learn from our failures. As Mr. Lamar said, "Sit down. Be humble."

✨Curiosity: we keep our minds open and never stop learning. We believe that questioning everything is the best way to stay ahead of the curve, and we encourage all our team members to stay curious and never stop exploring new ideas.

At Homa, you'll be challenged, supported, and inspired every day, and we can't wait to see what you bring to the table.

Benefits

While success is its own reward, here are some of the benefits that come with working at Homa:

  • We offer essential benefits in France and specific locations, including health insurance, meal vouchers, public transport subsidies, childcare benefits, and life insurance
  • If you're interested in working from our newly renovated Paris HQ with a rooftop garden and WeWork amenities, we have a desk waiting for you

Title: Sr Data Scientist
Description:
n AXPE Consulting estamos transformando el mundo de la Tecnología. Por ello, te invitamos a vivir una experiencia única desarrollando tu carrera en una Compañía multinacional que mira hacia el futuro. Nuestros valores definen nuestra identidad, son la palanca que nos ayuda a hacer realidad nuestro propósito y guían todas nuestras acciones y decisiones: apostamos por el TALENTO.




Desde el departamento de IT, buscamos un perfil de Sr Data Scientist para participar en un proyecto retador y tecnológicamente innovador con uno de nuestros clientes del sector retail👩‍🚀🚀




¿Cuál es tu reto?

Manejo de grandes volúmenes de datos con fines orientados al negocio de analítica o explotación de información.
El objetivo es realizar a partir de un gran volumen de datos su manipulación y análisis para extraer conocimientos en la toma de decisiones.
Emplearas técnicas de Big Data (Machine Learning, Inteligencia Artificial, Analítica Avanzada, etc.) y soluciones de visualización.
Comprensión del proceso de negocio y de los datos utilizados.
Modelización de algoritmos con estadística y programación avanzada.
Implementación de los datos en visualización, automatización de procesos y mantenimiento.




¿Qué buscamos de ti?

Experiencia de 4 años como Data Scientist.
Experiencia en el uso de herramientas como Python, Spark y PySpark.
Conocimientos avanzados con Datos SQL y no estructurados.
Conocimientos de Machine Learning y algoritmos de minería de datos.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?

📈 Oportunidad de desarrollar tu carrera en contexto global.

👨‍💻 Contrato indefinido.

⚕ Seguro médico a precio reducido (para ti y familiares directos).

📚 Formaciones y certificaciones a nuestro cargo, que te permitan crecer profesionalmente junto a nosotros.

⏰ Horario estándar con flexibilidad de entrada y salida.

📍 Modalidad híbrida en Madrid.

💸 Salario competitivo.

🚀 Formar parte de una compañía donde se fomentan las comunidades tecnológicas, el intercambio de conocimiento y la excelencia técnica.




En AXPE estamos orgullosos de ser una empresa experta en tecnología que apuesta fuerte por el talento. La responsabilidad corporativa es inherente a nuestro modelo de negocio, impulsamos la educación tecnológica tanto a nivel formativo como laboral.




📢 📢 Formar parte de AXPE es liderar la transformación del sector tecnológico.

Title: Global Data Scientist (fixed-term contract)
Description:
We are looking for a curious, creative, and business oriented Data Scientist, to work within our Global Data Science team to provide business and technical expertise in Advanced/Predictive/Prescriptive Analytics and GenAI projects.

Key responsibility will be to drive the execution of Data Science projects for the highly visible and groundbreaking Digital Transformation and Winning with Data initiatives; in particular the candidate will be focusing on the engagement of the countries’ team and deployment of the global DS strategies into the affiliates in a multicultural international environment. For this role, you should be highly analytical and business oriented with a love and high affinity for data analysis, math, and statistics. A strong candidate for this position should not only be skillful in quantitative methodologies and programming (holding themselves to a high standard for coding best practices), but also have a strong business acumen. He/she should have a passion for analysis, data exploration, machine-learning, and out of the box thinking and how to apply them to address relevant business questions. Utilization of related technical skills and methodologies and strive to remain abreast of leading-edge data science technologies.




What you'll be doing:

Serve as a key team member on the Advanced Data Science team, working in close partnership with the Digital Transformation and Wining with Data Global Commercial Capability teams and becoming a trusted partner to Global, Area and Affiliate leadership, ensuring data and digital strategy and key deliverables reflect advanced data science best practices.
Transform data into business insights that are useful for decision making and strategic planning utilizing complex statistical models and algorithms.
Develop innovative predictive models that are reliable, scalable, and modular and drive to business relevant outcomes.
Maintain, optimize, scale, and operationalize existing machine learning models in concert with key partners such as the Digital Transformation team, Business Technology Solutions (BTS), and external vendors/partners.
Utilize data sets of varying degrees of size and complexity and develop novel way to create creative predictive analytic solutions to work around data limitations.
Proactively identify new data science approaches that would improve our ability to answer commercial business questions by closely collaborate with key stakeholders to transform business questions to algorithms and further support the business needs
Drive the engagement of affiliates stakeholders to define business questions, requirements, timelines, objectives, and success criteria for data analysis/science initiatives.
Work with stakeholders to define business questions, requirements, timelines, objectives, and success criteria for data science initiatives.
Work closely with Business Technology Solutions (BTS) colleagues to ensure smooth transition of pilots into production, including technical guidance with respect to replication and scaling
Provide data science thought leadership in the Digital Transformation and Winning with data Capabilities strategic planning processes based on a deep understanding of advanced data science best practice approaches and their application to AbbVie’s commercial data to address business needs.
Ensure Advanced Data Science components and projects he/she is involved with for Digital Transformation and/or Winning with Data activities are conducted on time, accurately, within budget, and in accordance with financial and ethical compliance guidelines.




Your skills and qualifications:

Master degree required, with demonstration and focus in applied data science, in Statistics, Engineering, Operations Research, Computer Science or Economics.
Desirable: Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Statistics, Math, or Computing Science
Portfolio of work demonstrating data science applications (e.g. via GitHub/publications), including some or all of the following languages: Pyspark (highly desirable) and Python along with data science applications (e.g. via GitHub/publications).
Desirable: Expertise in other languages such as R, Java, C (C++, C#).
Desirable: Knowledge and usage of recommendation, clustering, segmentation algorithms, mix modeling, forecasting, optimization.
Desirable: GenAI, LLM and/or prompt engineering experience
Minimum of 6 years of applied data science and fields such as data engineering and predictive modeling or strong academic background in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or Computer Engineering
Minimum of 2 years of experience working in global roles interacting with multiple countries stakeholders in a matrix organization.
Strong experience developing and executing data science to address key business questions with positive, measurable outcomes.
Experience analyzing and drawing insights from key internally generated and external data sets
Analytical reasoning abilities, intellectual curiosity, strong business acumen, and creativity in problem solving
Strong communication skills, People person. Ability to interact effectively with/present to (verbally and in writing) all levels of the organization
Ability to be agile & nimble to changing business conditions, strong collaboration, and teamwork across functional groups to contribute to a productive work culture. Lead strategically and create trust and respect within the department.




The selected incumbent will be working as a contractor for AbbVie with a fixed-term duration contract.

Title: Data Scientist - H/F
Description:
Depuis sa création en 2018, OneSide Technologies s'est établi en tant qu'acteur dans le domaine du conseil en ingénierie et de l'expertise dans les secteurs de la mobilité terrestre, du médical, de la défense et de l'IOT. Nos équipes spécialisées dans les métiers de l'électronique, de la mécanique et logiciel permettent à nos collaborateurs d'évoluer sur des projets à forte valeur ajoutée, avec des missions long terme qui leur correspondent, dans un cadre professionnel stimulant et dans une entreprise à taille humaine.

En quelques chiffres, nous sommes :


Une entreprise de 130 collaborateurs, ambassadeurs de notre société
2 sites en France : Levallois-Perret et Mulhouse, avec une ambition de nous étendre sur le territoire français
11 millions de CA sur l'année 2022
Une forte croissance avec plus de 250 contrats signés en 5 ans.



Nous mettons tout en œuvre pour que nos employés bénéficient d'une intégration réussie et de projets qui leur correspondent vraiment, en fonction de leurs besoins, de leurs compétences et surtout, de leurs envies.

Chez OneSide Technologies, nous sommes convaincus que notre réussite dépend de celle de nos employés et de nos clients. Une réussite articulée autour de l'humain.

Le poste :

Votre rôle sera :


Analyse des données : Collecter, nettoyer et analyser des données physiologiques provenant de vêtements connectés.
Développement d'algorithmes : Concevoir, implémenter et optimiser des algorithmes de traitement du signal pour extraire des informations pertinentes à partir des données recueillies.
Modélisation statistique : Développer et appliquer des modèles statistiques et d'apprentissage automatique pour la détection et la prédiction d'événements de santé.
Validation et test : Mettre en place des protocoles de validation et de test pour évaluer la performance des algorithmes développés.
Collaboration interdisciplinaire : Travailler en collaboration avec les ingénieurs, les développeurs logiciels et les experts en santé pour intégrer les algorithmes dans les produits finis.
Documentation : Documenter les processus, les algorithmes et les résultats pour assurer la traçabilité et la reproductibilité des travaux.



Profil :

Vous avez le profil idéal si vous avez :


Diplôme(s) en Data Science, Mathématiques appliquées, Informatique, Traitement du signal ou domaine connexe.
Maîtrise (absolue) de Python et des bibliothèques de data science (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow/PyTorch).
Solides connaissances en traitement du signal et en analyse des signaux physiologiques.
Expérience en développement d'algorithmes de machine learning et deep learning.
Compétences en visualisation de données et utilisation d'outils comme Matplotlib, Seaborn ou Plotly.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About Translated

Translated is a leading company in AI-enabled translation services. We are on a mission to allow everyone to understand and be understood in their own language.

Our success stems from a unique blend of the world’s #1 adaptive neural machine translation technology (IDC MarketScape 2022), the largest network of vetted, native-speaking professional translators, and top-ranked AI-enabled text, audio, and video translation tools (Gartner, 2022).

By leveraging a seamless symbiosis of artificial intelligence and human creativity, we design custom localization projects that were previously unthinkable, helping more than 280,000 clients grow their businesses worldwide.

We’re looking for a passionate Machine Learning Engineer to join the Translated Data Science and AI Production team in our HQ in Pi Campus, Rome. The persona will be responsible for building and maintaining the Machine Learning and AI services of the company.

Key responsabilities


Lead the development of Machine Learning services
Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines
Improve and maintain our GPU cluster
Improve and maintain our API ecosystem
Optimize and put in production Machine Learning models
Collaborate with other team members on internal and external models
Coding, debugging and testing
Build high-quality reusable code that can be used in the future
Develop functional and sustainable applications with clean codes
Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of product owners, designers, developers and system administrators
Collaborate with the ModernMT and Research teams to create the best Translation Engine ever


Requirements


Master degree in Computer Science or SW Engineering courses
3+ years of working experience
Proven experience in developing and maintaining scalable Machine Learning and AI services
Deep Knowledge of Python, Java and Bash
Experience with Kubernetes and Docker
Experience with Relational DBMS ( MySQL, PostgreSQL )
Experience with NoSQL DBMS ( Redis, MongoDB )
Experience with version control GIT and Github workflow
Proactive, self-driven and enjoys solving complex problems, not just in the primary area of responsibility but across boundaries.


Headquarter

Translated is hosted at Pi Campus, a working environment immersed in nature where 7 luxury villas have been converted into functional offices to foster talent growth. Pi Campus is also a venture firm created by Translated to reinvest part of its profits into promising AI startups.

Benefits and Perks


Gym
Swimming Pool
Kickboxing, TRX, and Pilates classes
Table Tennis and Football table
Kitchen and snacks
Bonuses and incentives for employees who quit smoking, ride a bicycle to work, or adopt a child.


Learn more about our company: https://translated.com/work-at-translated-onboarding

Diversity statement

At Translated, we proudly embrace and celebrate each individual's unique qualities to our team, regardless of race, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other differences. We recognize that these diverse perspectives empower us to overcome challenges, foster innovation, and drive excellence. As an inclusive and equal-opportunity employer, we are committed to cultivating an environment where everyone feels welcome, valued, and supported to achieve their full potential.

Translated is a leading company in AI-enabled translation services. We are on a mission to allow everyone to understand and be understood in their own language.

Our success stems from a unique blend of the world’s #1 adaptive neural machine translation technology (IDC MarketScape 2022), the largest network of vetted, native-speaking professional translators, and top-ranked AI-enabled text, audio, and video translation tools (Gartner, 2022).

By leveraging a seamless symbiosis of artificial intelligence and human creativity, we design custom localization projects that were previously unthinkable, helping more than 280,000 clients grow their businesses worldwide.

We’re looking for a passionate Machine Learning Engineer to join the Translated Data Science and AI Production team in our HQ in Pi Campus, Rome. The persona will be responsible for building and maintaining the Machine Learning and AI services of the company.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
I am currently working with a healthcare scale up based in Amsterdam who are on the look-out for an experienced data scientist to join their team




Responsibilities:




Extract, clean, and analyze large and complex healthcare datasets, including electronic health records (EHR), claims data, and clinical trial data
Develop and implement predictive models and machine learning algorithms to address healthcare challenges, such as patient risk stratification, disease progression, and treatment optimization
Stay current with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and healthcare analytics
Collaborate with software engineers to deploy models into production environments




Requirements:




- Strong knowledge of Machine Learning

- 2+ years experience in data science

- Experience with predictive models is essential

- Experience with patient data is beneficial but not required

- Independent mentality and the drive to create your own path within an exciting company




Salary Package:




• Up to €90,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance

• Hybrid working and flexible working hours

• Pension scheme




If you are interested make sure to apply here or you can contact me on +31203997864 / George.Rayner@vividresourcing.com

Title: Marketing Data Scientist
Description:
Overview




Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world's visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions - and our methods for creating them - help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.




Our powerful culture has led to us being independently recognized on Fortune 100's Best Companies List and we are "Great Place to Work" Certified. We're driven, collaborative, ethical, and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our culture extends far beyond our own walls. Our corporate social responsibility efforts support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability.




At Keysight, Inclusion, Equity & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight - People and Culture - YouTube

Responsibilities

Keysight Global Marketing (KGM) is hiring a Marketing Data Scientist who will collaborate with team members to implement machine learning models leveraging data from sources across the sales and marketing pipeline. You will be joining a small, highly visible, analytics and operations team reporting into the CMO.







Primary Responsibilities




Use SQL and Python to build models leveraging data from multiple data sources across a multi-touch multi-contact organization-based customer journey
Explain model performance and provide recommendations for feature generation and selection to business users with limited experience in ML concepts
Build and deploy machine learning models leveraging packages like Scikit-learn and Pandas
Design reporting dashboards within Domo, our BI platform, following data visualization best practices
Identify gaps in processes and data collection to proactively ensure data quality across the marketing organization
Collaborate with fully remote teammates: communicating needs, coordinating work, and communicating timelines and deliverables across global time zones




Qualifications




BA in marketing, engineering, statistics, economics, computer science, or equivalent work experience
2+ years building and tuning machine learning models
2+ years working with B2B marketing data with an understanding of the lead journey, lead qualification processes, account-based marketing (ABM) metrics, and the marketing and sales pipeline
2+ years executing work as part of a project-based team (agile project management experience preferred)
1+ years working with Domo or 2+ years working with other BI platforms
Strong understanding of statistics and practical application of machine learning models
Ability to independently build, evaluate performance of, and tune machine learning models
Proficiency in Python; proficiency with git and version control; proficiency in working with APIs
Excellent interpersonal communication skills – especially in the context of a fully-remote team and work environment

Show more
